intro: Crepidiastrum sonchifolium subsp. sonchifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf groundsel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
